【緊急呼籲】空管的專業與良知

感謝一眾本地機師響應我們22/7的公開信，以及各大小媒體的關注。

於全球最繁忙機場之一工作，我們跟各行專業一樣，每天都面對極大的壓力和挑戰。我們沒有制服與誓詞，但我們嚴格遵循指引和法規履行職務，致力維護航空交通安全和效率。

從事人命攸關的專業，我們絕不能以壓力大或被人指罵情緒失控作為犯錯或疏忽職守的藉口。因為我們知道，一個細如微塵的錯誤決定都足以引發一場嚴重空難。每位旅客、機組及地勤人員的性命安全都是我們的責任。而香港人的性命安全，香港政府及警察理應責無旁貸。可是，時至今天，已經有六位市民選擇結束寶貴生命，以死控訴特區政府的施政失誤，但執政者依然無動於衷、視而不見。

作為航空界的專業人士，我們明白我們肩負社會責任，即使看到社會上發生的種種不公義，也一直默默地緊守崗位；但作為香港人，過去的每一枚催淚彈、每一槍布袋彈、每一棍黑勢力的毒毆，都狠狠地打在我們的心上。人民在哀號，我們的家失去了秩序，我們還可以憑甚麼繼續沈醉工作，埋沒良心、默不作聲、助紂為虐呢？

今天，我們不能只說專業，更要講良知。

對於特區政府高層及警隊，就上環的開槍事件和元朗恐怖襲擊所提出的那些毫無重點、毫無建設性、是非顛倒的回應及解說，我們感到極之憤怒。我們不得不站起來，與業界一同參與26/7的機場集會。我們在此呼籲，香港特別行政區政府對於民間五大訴求*提出有建設性的回應。否則，我們不排除行動升級，進行不合作運動。

我們明白香港國際機場的客貨運量冠絕全球，假如機場不能正常運作將導致嚴重經濟損失。但是，專業就是以公眾安全為先，我們只能做應做的事。

作為航空管制員，我們專業與良知同行。

#黑衣為記

五大訴求
1. 撤回逃犯條例
2. 撤回暴動定義
3. 撤回所有抗爭者控罪
4. 成立獨立調查委員會
5. 立即實行雙普選





[Urgent Appeal] Professionalism and Conscience of Air Traffic Controllers
 
We appreciate the support from local pilots as well as the awareness from media with regards to our open letter dated 22 July.
 
Working in one of the busiest airports in the world, we face enormous pressure and challenge every day, which makes us comparable to professionals from all other fields. Although we do not wear uniform and are not required to swear an oath, we are obliged to follow guidelines and regulations strictly when we perform our duties in order to maintain a safe and efficient flow of air traffic.
 
To work in a profession where life and death matters, either stress or being blamed by others is not an excuse of making mistakes or negligence. A minor miscalculation could easily result in a disaster. We owe a social responsibility to every passenger, flight crew and ground crew in the same way the government and Police Force owe every Hong Kong people. Regrettably, six citizens of this city chose to end their lives to accuse the administrative mistakes committed by the government while the later still pay no attention to the tragedy till this day.
 
As aviation professionals, we strive to discharge our duties without complaints despite the injustice acts that had happened in this city. On the other hand, as Hong Kong citizens, we are deeply saddened by the tear gas canisters, bean bag rounds and rubber bullets that were fired by the Police as well as the violence acts committed by armed mobs. As we hear the people cry and witness the city descends into chaos, we feel that it is not right to continue to perform our duties silently as if nothing has happened and let the abusers get away with their evil deeds.
 
Today, we not only focus on professionalism; we turn to our conscience.
 
We feel furious on the pointless, nonconstructive and sometimes misleading comments given by senior government officials and Hong Kong Police Force. We have no choice but to stand up and join our fellow colleagues in the aviation community in the airport protest on 26 July. Meanwhile, we urge the government to provide positive response to the five demands* by the people. If no such response is given, we do not rule out the possibility of taking further actions such as uncooperative movement.
 
The airport is the world's busiest cargo gateway and one of the world's busiest passenger airports. There will be huge economic loss if the operation of the airport is inefficiently hindered. Yet, if we turn to our conscience, we know that the safety of Hong Kong people should always be on the top of the economy. We will do what should be done.
 
We are professional air traffic controllers; we are conscientious air traffic controllers.

#WearBlack

Five Demands
1. Complete withdrawal of the extradition bill
2. Retraction of the “riot” characterisation of 12 June protest
3. Release and exoneration of arrested protesters
4. Formation of independent commission of inquiry
5. Immediate implementation of universal suffrage
